Description: Body sherd of Rhodian pottery Vroulia cup, probably with everted rim; interior glazed black; band of incised triangle pattern between incised bands; below, part of incised lotus flower; exterior reserved handle zone; glazed black below with single incised band.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the interior decoration, see Kinch 1914 p. 186, fig. 67a-b. Kinch places that sherd in his Group B without further precision because of the lack of diagnostic features (reserved handle zone or stemmed foot). If the sherd Kinch published is indeed of the same type as this sherd, we can further precise its grouping to either Group B 1.α Group B 1.β on account of the reserved handle zone. According to Schlotzhauer, Vroulia cups with a reserved handle zone with a geometric pattern and with a shape similar to South Ionian cups with everted rims (Schlotzhauer Type 8, which coincides with Vallet and Villiard's Ionian cup type A1 and Hayes' Ionian cup type III) may be contemporary and ought to be dated amongst the earliest examples of Vroulia pottery at Naukratis. Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88 Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GN.15) (phase 3)
